title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 195-2.2 - Company stores
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 195-2.2 - Company stores

State Regulations

No person engaged in construction of public work under
contract with the State or with any municipal corporation either as a
contractor or subcontractor shall, directly or indirectly, conduct what is
commonly known as a company store if there is any store selling supplies within
two miles of the place where such contract is being executed. Charges for
groceries, provisions, board, lodging or clothing shall not be a valid off-set
in behalf of the employer against wages. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
195-2.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
